    • Method Detail

      • addEvent

        @PostMapping(value="/api/addEvent")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity addEvent(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                                                                             @RequestBody
                                                                                             FrontEndEvent fe)
        Adds specified event. Id is unnecessary.
        Parameters:
        session - No need to provide.
        fe - The frontend wrapper for the event requesting to be created.
        Returns:
        HTTP 200 if successful, HTTP 500 otherwise

      • getEvents

        @GetMapping(value="/api/getEvents")
 @ResponseBody
public java.util.List<FrontEndEvent> getEvents(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                                                                                    @RequestParam
                                                                                                    int groupId)
        Returns all events in the requested group. Returns empty list of user is not part of group.
        Parameters:
        session - No need to provide.
        groupId - This is the id of the group you want to get events from.
        Returns:
        Events in the requested group.

      • deleteEvent

        @PostMapping(value="/api/deleteEvent")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteEvent(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                                                                                   @RequestParam
                                                                                                   int eventId)
        Delete an event by its ID
        Parameters:
        session - Session
        eventId - Event ID
        Returns:
        HTTP 200 if successful, HTTP 500 otherwise

        @PostMapping(value="/api/updateEvent")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity updateEvent(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                                                                                   @RequestParam
                                                                                                   FrontEndEvent event)
        Update an event that already exists
        Parameters:
        session - Session
        event - Front end event with updates made
        Returns:
        HTTP 200 if successful, HTTP 500 otherwise

      • getEventsForUser

        @GetMapping(value="/api/getEventsForUser")
 @ResponseBody
public java.util.List<FrontEndEvent> getEventsForUser(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                                                                                                  @RequestParam
                                                                                                                  int userId)
        Returns a list of events for a given user id
        Parameters:

        userId - ID of user to get events for
        Returns:

      • getEventFeedback

        @GetMapping(value="/api/getEventFeedback")
 @ResponseBody
public java.util.List<FrontEndEventComment> getEventFeedback(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                                                                                                         @RequestParam
                                                                                                                         int eventId)
        Gets comments for an event
        Parameters:
        session - Session
        eventId - ID of event to get comments for
        Returns:
        List of comments for event. No particular ordering.

      • postEventFeedback

        @PostMapping(value="/api/postEventFeedback")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity postEventFeedback(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                                                                                               @RequestParam
                                                                                                               int eventId,
                                                                                                               @RequestParam(required=false,defaultValue="-1")
                                                                                                               int parentId,
                                                                                                               @RequestParam
                                                                                                               java.lang.String comment,
                                                                                                               @RequestParam
                                                                                                               boolean isPrivate)
        Post a comment about an event
        Parameters:
        session - Session
        eventId - ID of event to comment on
        parentId - Parent of comment (use to create sub-comments)
        comment - Text of comment
        isPrivate - Specifies if this comment is private
        Returns:
        HTTP 200 if successful, HTTP 500 otherwise
